history.content:
D-

source: https://registrar.berkeley.edu/faculty-staff/grading/grading-policies-reports 

Do note that you need to "Maintain a minimum overall grade point average of 2.00 (C average) and a minimum grade point average of 2.00 in upper division technical coursework required of your major.", with a D- giving you a .7 GPA https://engineering.berkeley.edu/2019-20-undergraduate-guide/2019-20-degree-requirements/#ac12234 

For 16B last fall there were 15 F's and 3 NP's https://berkeleytime.com/grades/0-7920-fall-2019-sahai,-a-_-1, but if you just do bare minimum on labs and score very poorly on exams, I believe D- and above is achievable. If I had to guess, most F's/NP's were people who dropped the class/plan to take in future semester to replace F grade and stopped doing work/didn't show up to Final, or those who cheated.
What is the lowest grade that is considered as a passing grade for EECS 16B and that allows one to graduate as an EECS Major?
history.subject: EECS 16B Passing Grade
